intro: Fleischmannia anisopoda, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant has a woody stem and is typically found in dry, rocky habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, with a hairy texture that helps reduce water loss. The showy yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
